meanings.definition: Intended to gain favor or approval
meanings.sent1: Her ingratiatory smile won over the entire team.
meanings.sent2: She used ingratiatory gestures to win the client's trust.
meanings.sent3: His ingratiatory behavior at the party was so obvious, it made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The politician's ingratiatory speeches were like sweet music to the ears of the voters.
meanings.sent5: The cat's ingratiatory purring always melted her heart.

meanings.definition: Acting in a way to make oneself more likable or agreeable
meanings.sent1: The student's ingratiatory attitude towards the teacher was evident in every class.
meanings.sent2: He put on an ingratiatory tone to convince his friends to join him.
meanings.sent3: The dog's ingratiatory wagging tail never failed to bring a smile to everyone's face.
meanings.sent4: Her ingratiatory behavior was like a well-rehearsed act on a stage.
meanings.sent5: The chef's ingratiatory compliments to the customers made them feel special.
